Reviews.Title: Go for it - this is a great deal
Reviews.Author: pepsundar
Reviews.Content: I ordered this item with standard shipping option on Monday evening. The order confirmation email stated that item will be shipped in 5-8 business days; but it was deliveredf at my door steps on Wednesday! Very Fast..As such this is a great deal with 18-55mm and 55-300mm lenses, and the product description page doesn't say anything else other than the camera and lenses, I was pleasantly surprised to find the following additional goodies as part of the package:1. Nikon School DVD2. Nikon DSLR Bag3. Lens HoodI'm sure the above items would cost at least another $75 - D5100, with two lenses and the above all put together, this is a great deal!

Reviews.Title: Like the snaps it captures...
Reviews.Author: Deepak
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome... You just need to know how to click it. It outperforms in all conditions of light. No cons as of yet.The quality of images is excellent...

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: William Hertsenberg
Reviews.Content: I have been shooting for 44 years, although this isn't the top of line NIkon, it still will do everything anyone who is an amateur can possibly want. By amatuer i mean anyone not getting paid by National Geographic or the MLB people. All of the functions on these dslr's a re very nice. in the past you would have had to figure out all these varying settings with light meters and f/stops.I still will use a light meter and set my own f/stops with this rig. Just because i understand all the functions well. I would reccomend anyone who has this camera to take a class if this is your first camera. there are soo many features it would be impossible for a first or maybe even a second time camera user to figure them all out. It's amazing what microprocessors have done in the last few years.The other fabulous thing about these types of camera's is to get the most memory and highest rated recording cards so you can fire away at will and then just delete what you don't like or want. In the past, one would have to pay for processing and see what happened and have many pics you didn't like or want. I will eventually get 1000mm lens as well. but for now this was quite the deal for the camera and two lenses. It's been replaced with the 5200 24 megapixel since the new year, but if you can find one of these and are looking for great camera and great deal... here it is..... and use the hood.. that's why they put it in with the lens.... :) good luck and enjoy this camera if you choose...

Reviews.Title: Nikon D5100
Reviews.Author: Christmas Story fan
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera after seeing all the good reviews and were very happy when we received it. We were very pleased to get a camera bag, tripod, cleaning solution, 32 GB card, etc. with the camera which hadn't been advertised when we bought it! After using it the first time we came home and found the little "door" that protects the battery was gone. I have no idea how it could have fallen off, but I contacted "Beach Camera" to see if I could get a replacement door, and they were very nice about it and ask me to send the camera back.  They then sent me a whole new camera with everything I had received before. {There was some reason they couldn't just replace the door.} My husband and I love this camera; it takes excellent photos and is everything we hoped it would be. We aren't pros so we got a couple of books for the Nikon D5100 and are studying them so we can learn all there is to learn about it. We're going on vacation soon and hope to bring back some great photos! This was well worth the money, and Beach Camera was very good to deal with.

Reviews.Title: Going to be a while before I outgrow this one
Reviews.Author: Karla U "KMU"
Reviews.Content: I spent a little more for the longer lens - and it was worth it.  My old camera only had the 35mm equivalent of 300mm zoom, and this one is the equivalent of quite a bit more than that.  I'm taking action shots of stock cars on a dirt track, and having a longer lens will be nice.  Be aware when buying accessories ahead of time (like UV filters), that the smaller lens is 52mm and the larger one is 58mm in diameter.

Reviews.Title: Nikon D5100
Reviews.Author: PW
Reviews.Content: This camera takes beautiful pictures!!!  I've had some very nice moderately priced cameras over the years, but this one has the quality/precision/clarity that gives you back exactly what you are seeing!!!

Reviews.Title: It's just what I wanted
Reviews.Author: W. Coop
Reviews.Content: After spending 6 months comparing different cameras the d5100 meets or exceeds all of my expectations.  I would recommend this camera to any aspiring photography buff

Reviews.Title: Loving it.
Reviews.Author: A. Greenamyre "mystical.pixie"
Reviews.Content: This is my first slr. Love it. Very easy to use for beginners. Takes excellent quality pictures. Price is right.

Reviews.Title: Leaps and bounds better than my old D100
Reviews.Author: mad G.I.
Reviews.Content: Even though I dropped in the level of camera (professional vs intermediate/entry level) class of DSLR, the difference in quality and ability is astounding. Maybe a lot of that has to do with the newer, and probably better quality lenses that I now have, but in features alone, this camera does everything the D100 did, better, and does so much more.I have enjoyed some of the built in program modes (i.e. portrait, sports, scenery, ect.), I still have full creative control over the exposure when I want it. There are a lot of menu's and sub-menu's that you have to learn) to get at the heart of the camera, and there is certainly a learning curve, but nothing overwhelming for those familiar with Nikon cameras. I am still learning more, every time I pick the camera up, and try something new.One of my passions, has always been storm photography, and meteor shower photography, and I was left with a bad taste in my mouth, with my experience with digital, long exposure results. Noise was an absolute killer in the D100, and I have had that nervous feeling in the pit of my stomach, ever since I switched to digital. Would I ever be able to capture meteors, lightening, and other celestial events, with a digital camera, like I did with film?The answer to that question is an astoundingly loud, YES. The internal noise reduction of the Nikon D5100 is amazing. I have done 15" exposures of the sky just after sunset, with amazing results, capturing a passing meteor with no problems using an ISO of 200. After some time, as the sky darkened, I kicked it up to ISO 400, with that tense knot in my stomach, worried about the amount of noise it would create. I did not want to take longer exposures, so the ISO was the only option to capture more light. To my absolute delight, the photos retain the color, sharpness, with little or no color shift, and comparing photos side by side, or transposing, I see only stars, and the planets that rose with the night sky. Very little, if any, noise at all.This camera has the exact same sensor, as it's more expensive big brother, the D7000, for half the price. It only has 11 focal points, but they are in enough area's of the frame, to do more than enough to keep you happy. I have found that you lose a lot of creative control, by using the default focus settings, which use multiple points, to arrange the composition, leaving you with a strangely, just out of focus, scene, nothing is quite sharp, nor blurry. I tend now to use only single focal points, to give me greater control over accuracy, and depth of field (f/stop, focus depth).I have only begun to scratch the surface of this camera, and it's capabilities. I was sad to see the D5200 announced, only days after I purchased this model, but when I look at the specs, side by side, there is not much offered on the newer model, that I can't live with out.A camera is a tool, and it is really only bound by your desire to explore new ways of shooting. I have serious doubts that I will ever outgrow the capability of this camera, it will die, long before that happens. If they can do so much now, I wonder what the future will bring?Nikon hit a home run with this camera, and I am glad that my trusty old D100 died, giving me the opportunity to buy this kit, and re-ignite my passion for low light photography.

Reviews.Title: Hubby loves it
Reviews.Author: nfnanners1970
Reviews.Content: This camera takes amazing pics.  The lens is unreal how close it brings the images and so clear.  I would highly recommend it.  My husband always stuck with Olympus and this is his first Nikon and he really likes it better.

Reviews.Title: Nikon can't go wrong
Reviews.Author: peebody
Reviews.Content: The 5100 is super user friendly.  Just started playing with and basically had it all figured out. Take beautiful auto photos and relatively easy to manipulate in manual mode.

Reviews.Title: I'm no Pro! But I can't see any, Cons, about this awesome camera.
Reviews.Author: Randall Mooney
Reviews.Content: Looks Great after 3 months of shooting!  Just can't wait to take it to Hawaii. I've back packed it to the sea and all the way up to the top of some pretty tall mountains. It hasn't let me down in any way yet.I’m way passed Auto now, but it has great quality and I love it when things happen fast. Like the Condor or the Bald eagle that seemed to come out of nowhere, or that perfect smile.The 300mm lens works for me as I may get a bit closer to the subject than some.For an amateur I think this camera set is better than great it’s above and beyond.When I open my photo gallery up on my big screen HD there is only one word that comes to my mind,“WOW!”“It puts me back in that moment, just fine!”

Reviews.Title: Produto entregue  no prazo. Atendeu minhas expectativas quanto a qualidade.
Reviews.Author: Dário Gonçalves de Melo Junior
Reviews.Content: Produto entregue  no prazo combinado, não cobrou frete. Atendeu minhas expectativas quanto a qualidade. Facilidade no cadastro e forma de pagamento segura.

Reviews.Title: awsome
Reviews.Author: tictac2013
Reviews.Content: Awsome camera. I can see big differences in pictures between all my other cameras. Just like what they say..you get what you pay for and this is so far worth my spending. I am certainly happy with it.

Reviews.Title: 2nd buy
Reviews.Author: Harish Belwal
Reviews.Content: I already have the D5100.  I recommended it to a friend over the D90 as a better value for money for the non-professional but serious amateur.  He made me buy it for him.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Bill Schreiber
Reviews.Content: Excellent package for the price. Easy to use. We have taken 383 pictures sine Christmas and, except for the crappy digital storage card, we could not be happier. If you buy this camera make sure that you buy a name brand storage device or you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Good choice
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: Good choice for amateurs photographers. This camera fits on the hands. The articulated lcd display makes the difference when you rec a movie.

Reviews.Title: Nikon D5100 camera
Reviews.Author: shirl
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with my Nikon D5100 camera.  It is doing everything I had hoped for.  I am also glad that I bought the 55-300 VR zoom lens with it and have been able to get some nice close-ups of birds.

Reviews.Title: Nikon D5100 16.2 MP Digital SLR
Reviews.Author: Annette Taulbee
Reviews.Content: The Nikon D5100 does take wonderful movies of more distant soccer games, scenery, family gatherings, weddings and yes it is a camera. The variety of options and quality of photographs is absolutely Stunning. I find it to be magnificent all around high end camera for amateurs.CLF

Reviews.Title: Veru good experience e product, i recomend
Reviews.Author: anferreira
Reviews.Content: Is was a very good experience. I recomend this item / product.I received before estimated date. It is important!!

Reviews.Title: Its Cool
Reviews.Author: sunny
Reviews.Content: I have not tested the videos, but the picture quality is pretty good. And also the 55 - 300 mm lens is really good.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: FL Girl
Reviews.Content: Had an older Nikon without the video feature and was so satisfied with it that we definitely wanted to stick with Nikon.  I debated between the 5100 and the 7000 - glad I chose this and saved the money.  It is really above and beyond the capabilities we need  as amateur photographers.

Reviews.Title: NIKON D5100 SLR
Reviews.Author: William C. Edwards, Jr.
Reviews.Content: This is my first digital SLR and I am still learning how to use it most effectively.  I just attended the NIKON SCHOOL conducted in my area and was most impressed with their presentations -- over two days.  I was also impressed with the features of the D5100 as described there along with other models.  I have not had it long enough to check it out thoroughly but I am satisfied with what I see thus far.

ProductInfo.Features:
16.2 MP DX-Format CMOS Sensor
Built-In Speedlight Flash With i-TTL
3.0" Vari-Angle 921K Resolution LCD
ISO Sensitivity 100-6400
In-Camera HDR (High Dynamic Range)
Fast 11-Point Autofocus System
1080p HD Movies w/Full Time Autofocus
Nikkor 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6G VR Lens
35mm Equivalent: 27-82.5mm Lens
In-Camera Special Effects Mode
ProductInfo.Name: Nikon D5100 Digital SLR Camera & 18-55mm G VR DX AF-S & 55-300mm VR Zoom Lens
